intro: Guarea spicata, commonly known as the spicata guarea, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and large, palmately lobed leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically appearing in axillary inflorescences. The fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
